head.title: STERLING PUBLIC SCHOOLS - Sterling Public Schools

img.style: margin-top: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 10px; border-width:0; max-width:100%

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

div.strong:
This is a tough time and this is when Sterling Tigers rise above. Everyone at the school is so sorry for how the end of this school year has come about, but we also want to keep each and every student, parent, staff member, and community member safe. The teachers and principals have worked tirelessly to put together a distance learning plan that will give each student an opportunity to continue learning and preparing for their future. Each student has been contacted by the principals to gather technology information, and the plan to issue computers and enrichment packets on April 6, 2020, is posted on the school website. We want each student to work hard and keep learning. Sterling Public Schools is here for our students, so if you have any problems or questions contact your teacher or an administrator. The administrator emails are:
Marty Curry, currym@sterling.k12.ok.us
Sandy Fehring, sfehring@sterling.k12.ok.us
Kent Lemons, klemons@sterling.k12.ok.us
​
We are not sure at this time what we will do about all the events that have been put off. We will know more as this crisis moves along. As the information changes we will let everyone know. Right now, we want everyone to be safe.
One thing we can always do is be proud to be a Tiger, so Rise Up Sterling Tigers and make the most out of the remainder of this school year. Stay safe and stay Tiger Strong.
Kent Lemons

span.font: Distance Learning Begins; Thank You to Staff and Parents from the Board of Education

br.span: Dear Friends of Sterling Public Schools:

This week marks the beginning of a new and unexpected experience for Oklahoma students, teachers and school staff. Although we did not anticipate ending the year this way, I am proud of the distance learning plan Sterling Public Schools has developed to allow students to learn from home. We know this change is difficult, and there is sadness about missing or delaying special events and activities. During this time, students and their families can count on Sterling Public Schools to support them, both academically and emotionally.

While this health crisis has presented many challenges, it also has given us opportunities to help one another. In one week, the district’s child nutrition team served 273 meals to local children. Additionally, our staff completed the massive task of developing a distance learning plan in just a matter of days. The board and our community commend and thank all school employees for their hard work and commitment. Sterling Public Schools has an incredible team.

Also, the Board and the schools appreciate the community passing the bond in 2018 allowing the school to purchase technology, among other things. The technology purchase prepared us for this distance learning period we did not know was coming.

The next few weeks will unveil a temporary new normal for us all. Kitchen tables will double as classroom/office spaces, and our world will be limited to the walls of our own homes. I would like to thank parents for partnering with the district on this journey. While they will be assisting their children in person, they will not be alone. Teachers will be just a phone call, email or videoconference away.

We are fortunate to serve a community that values public education and understands that flexibility is necessary to meet the needs of students. A school is not a building; it is a family of caring, knowledgeable professionals making a difference for students every day. Our district is home to the best, and they will finish the school year strong.
Thank you for your support of Sterling Public Schools
The Sterling Public Schools Board of Education
I hope everyone is staying safe. Monday, April 20

will be the time to drop off any hard copies of paperwork that couldn’t be turned in by email or other means. Make sure your students name, subject, and teacher name is on the each assignment that is returned. We will allow any paperwork that is returned to be quarantined for a week or more before our teachers look over the paperwork. The elementary will be handing out more assignments if needed for your child’s class. The JH, HS and some elementary classes sent home all the assignments for the semester on the original packet day. Drop off times will be from 5:00PM-7:00PM on Monday, April 20

. The drop off locations will be the same as they were for the original packet day. Teacher’s emails are located on the school website under the District and staff directory if you need to ask questions about assignments. Just a reminder we prefer work be sent back by email or digitally if possible. These are very unusual times for everyone and especially our children. Please be safe and we will all get through this together. Go Tigers!

div.br:
I am a Sterling Tiger,
This is where I belong.
I strive for excellence,
So our tradition will stand strong.
I do everything with dedication and pride.
I keep my hopes up and spirit alive.
I have the dignity to try and power to succeed.
WE ARE THE TIGERS, FOREVER WE WILL BE
